basic.description: Contributions of Darwinian evolutionary theory to the understanding of contemporary culture.  Through seminars, essays, and group discussions, students explore ideas, research objectives, and recent discoveries in applying Darwinism to the interpretation of cultural products like art and literature, social-cultural institutions like religion and marketing, societal problems like war and environmental conservation, and emerging designs for new models of sustainable civilization in the 21st century.
basic.subject: BIOL
basic.title: Darwinism and cultural evolution
